title: Allier Capital injects senior banker for health sector coverage
text:
Matthew Stubbs’ boutique corporate advisory firm Allier Capital has made another surgical strike on the healthcare sector, hiring ex-Barclays investment banker Steven Boggiano to lead Allier’s coverage of the industry.

Allier has overseen several deals in the white-hot health space in recent months, including the sale of Regional Radiology Group to the country's largest medical imaging and radiology clinic network I-MED Radiology and Quadrant Private Equity-backed Qscan's acquisition of Alpenglow.

Allier Capital, led by Matthew Stubbs (front) has scooped up another managing director. Ben Rushton

But Stubbs’ firm has also played a significant role in the $970 million privatisation of vet group Greencross by global buyout giant TPG last year, and the $1.23 billion sale of Australian drug developer and marketer iNova Pharmaceuticals to The Carlyle Group and Pacific Equity Partners in 2017.

Steven Boggiano is well known in Australian capital markets and has worked on both sides of the street in recent years.

He spent almost six years at Barclays in Sydney as head of healthcare, consumer and retail coverage before shifting in August 2016 to Estia Health, where he served as chief strategy officer. He set up his own firm Magnes Capital in late 2017.

Boggiano will bring some serious advisory firepower in the health sector, having worked on deals including Healthscope take-private in 2010 ; the acquisition of aged care operator Allity by Archer Capital; Estia’s takeover by Quadrant and Archer Capital's acquisition of Healthe Care.
description: Matthew Stubbs’ boutique corporate advisory firm Allier Capital has made another surgical strike on the healthcare sector.
